course_title: SEM: Topics in Public Health Law
class_notes: Available to pre-selected students during registration only.
course_description: This seminar provides an opportunity to write a paper on a topic related to public health law. During the first two-thirds of the semester, reading assignments will include the control of pandemics (both globally and in the U.S.), federal and state government health powers, constitutional limitations, and public health emergency law. The remainder of the semester will be devoted to presentations by students based upon a draft of their seminar papers.
sections: Class Nbr: 2413, Section #: 000, Type: SEM, Campus: ATL, Meets: W 2-4p, Instructor: P. Price, Status: Open
